data.meta_description: Hello! I'm Alex, and having been inspired by other LinkedIn posts, I decided to share my success story - I received an offer to study Medicine at the‚Ä¶ | 25 comments on LinkedIn
data.text: Hello! I'm Alex, and having been inspired by other LinkedIn posts, I decided to share my success story - I received an offer to study Medicine at the University of Cambridge! üéâüéâüéâ This has been the culmination of different factors, and it has been a long, arduous journey to get to where I am today. I'd like to share the main lesson I have learnt from accomplishing this feat: Hard work, with luck, cultivates success. üí™ It should come to no surprise that hard work is necessary to achieve success. Coming from a school with an Ofsted rating of "Requires Improvement", I had to learn to make the most of my situation. I studied, answered, and looked to my teachers for advice. This cycle repeated until I was able hone my skills in my GCSEs, allowing me to achieve ten grade 9s. Similar perseverance also allowed me to gain top 1% scores in the entrance exams for studying Medicine at University in the UK. These examples demonstrate the effects of hard work - through proper and consistent efforts, we can hope to achieve satisfactory results. üçÄ However, I'd like to also highlight the importance of luck in success. There have been times where luck was very much on my side. For one, I am part of a caring and supportive family, something I have learnt not to take for granted. Moreover, I took my GCSEs in 2022, when the effects of COVID, though declining, were still present. This meant GCSEs were made slightly easier - a life-saver, when my school couldn't cover the full syllabus of many subjects. Additionally, I was fortunate for my school allowing me to take an extra GCSE to remain competitive for applying to Oxbridge. These examples illustrate the role of luck in success - while hard work is essential, a dose of good luck never hurts. üåü Overall, I'm fairly proud of this offer. My next steps involve focusing on getting the grades required for me to fulfill my offer - notably, an A* in Chemistry. I have also realised that I can share my knowledge and progress to help other students achieve their goals. More on this soon... :) Thank you for reading. If you'd like to share similar sentiments or stories, please feel free to do so in the comments! üî• #cambridge #cambridgeuniversity #universityofcambridge
